archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.abstract: The diaries of Margaret Lynn Templeton, (1895-1978), of Staunton, Va., contain personal entries documenting her social, academic, and business life.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
Univeristy of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of Margaret Lynn Templeton, Accession #11125 , Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These diaries were made a gift to the Library by Joan Jacobs Brumberg of Cornell University, Ithaca, New York, on November 10, 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: There are five volumes of diaries, December 1915 through March 18, 1934, kept by Margaret Lynn Templeton (1895-1978) of Staunton, Virginia. There are personal entries documenting her social, academic and business life. There are frequent references to military and social activities; officers, cadets, and students; and school buildings at Staunton Military Academy, Virginia Military Institute, and Washington and Lee University. References to Virginia Military Institute include drilling and marching, dress parades, graduation, balls and dances, patriotic pageants, and the library. Also mentioned are the Ambulance Unit and Society Celebration at Washington and Lee University. There is a mention of Helen Keller being at the New Theatre (May 1916).

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: Volume I:7 pages 1-56, December 31, 1915 - January 6, 1917, written on recto; pages 57-112, January 13, 1917 - November 3, 1917, written on verso.

Volume II:pages 113-270 (271 blank), November 4, 1917 - October 13, 1919; list of "1919-1920 Dances"; [index] of 1918-1920; "Cadets I knew in 1918-1919"; and, "Dore House Bunch 1918- 1919" following last page of diary.
Volume III:pages unnumbered, October 18, 1919 - September 9, 1921; "Dances 1919- 1920" and "Dances 1920-1921" on front cover; [index] of 1920-1921 following last page of diary.

descgrp.head: Select Diary Entries
descgrp.p: 1916 Jan:[at Curry's playing and dancing; tea at Mrs. J. A. Alexander; [Warren] Giles; Mr. Pine; Mr. and Mrs. Vernon Castle in the "Whirl of Life"; Mrs. Terry; mother; Harold Lockwood and May Allison in "End of the Road"; Miss Evie and Miss Moss; Mary Pickford in "Madam Butterfly"; dance at Staunton Military Academy; Mr. McKelvey; [dansant] at Mrs. S. D. Timberlake, Jr's; Junior meeting; dancing class; Starke; Eleanor; Eleanor Curry; Harold Lockwood at the New Theatre; to sally port; to M. S. B. to Anton Kaspar's recital; Francis Bell's sister; "Armstrong's wife"]

1916 May:[Lawrence Williams; on train with Virginia Military Institute baseball team and Staunton Military Academy track team; Helen Keller at the New Theatre; Edwin Wayland; Stuart Hall; work on the Bessie Hunton essays; Mr. Church; Mr. Hann; Neal Chapin; Collier; Billy Thomas; Anne Willard; Mary Pickford in "Poor Little Peppina"; party for the Spanish boys at Staunton Military Academy given by Miss Houston; tea at the McDowell's; Eleanor; Staunton Military Academy boys left for camp; "Wisdom" Boykin; Church left for Annapolis; McDonnell; Mary and Carrie Walke; Miss Baugh; Miss Gammon; Dad; Mother; Deborah and Lewis; tea at Mrs. Swimley's for Ruth Guyer; Page; Mr. Mantor; Mr. Driscoll; Major Anderson; Mr. McGiffert; Mr. Lafferty; Virginia Military Institute final invitation; Mr. Stevenson; downtown; McKelvey; cadets return from camp; Dress Parade; Starke; Carter; Katherine Paul; Hanson; final drills; Martha Hancher; Edith Bayles; commencement exercises at the New Theatre; Guy C. Jackson]

1916 June:[Willis Hann; Starke; Wright; graduate recital at Stuart Hall; party for choir at Mr. McDowell's; Miss Mattie Shreckhise; Alumnae meeting at Stuart Hall; movies; Alumnae Banquet at Virginia Hotel; final recital at Stuart Hall; final exercises at Stuart Hall; Virginia Eddy received the Bessie Hunton Essay prize; to Lexington; meeting of the Federation of Women's Club; Mary Walke; Major Anderson; Virginia Military Institute Library; Mr. McGiffert; Benny Bowering; Mr. Scriven; Mr. Harrison; Janet Hughes; Captain Snidow; Mother; Dad; Society Celebration at Washington and Lewis University; dedication of Doremus Gymnasium; Dress Parade; Joe Collins; reception at Dr. Smith's house; Mr. Smithson; Mr. Houston; Mr. Houston Showell; Mr. Masinter; Washington and Lewis University final exercises; Mr. Driscoll; card for the dances; Opening Hop; Neal Chapin; Mr. Porter; Billy Thomas; Horace L. Smith '15 ; track meet; Maury "Wisdom" Boykin; Mr. Ingram; Mr. Porcher; Will Chapin; Mrs. Pratt; Janet; Miss Bauers; W. B. Bradford; Mr. Campbell; Mr. Lafferty; service at Virginia Military Institute; "Son" Read; Guard Mounting; Mr. Ingram; Ida May Digges; Dress Parade; the Archers; the Meade's; Mayhew Mantor; the German, Douglas Fraser; alumni had a figure; Francis Bell; combat exercises; on Hill for Graduation Parade; alumni drill; John C. Parker '14; Captain Snidow; dances; Alumni Banquet; Joe Collins received the Garnett Andrews prize for best essay on a military subject; "Little Thomas"; graduation exercises; Mr. Harrison]

1917 Mar:[played Grafonola; left for Washington; Mother; Aunt "N" [Nellie] and Mrs. Austin on train; at Winchester, party of boys from the Shenandoah Military Academy got on the train; Mr. Lovell; Inauguration guests; St. Andrews; Miss Hazard; presidential parade; Woodrow Wilson passed; to Hibbs Building to see fireworks; visited the Monument, the Capitol and the White House; White House closed to visitors due to explosion that wrecked the East Room; trouble with suffragettes the previous day; Huyler's; a Victor store; Cumberland Apartments; saw Great Expectations with Jack Pickford and Louise Huff; left Washington for Staunton; Mr. Downing, Virginia Military Institute cadet; Harpers Ferry; Mr. Waters; dancing classes; Frank O'Connor; Teddy [Clark]; Billy [Ferris]; Forrester; Wehrly; Dennett; Saturday night dance; Hutchings; Walker; Ortez; Captain Lykes; Major [Ferris]; David Bell; "Retreat"; Mr. "Andy" Grose; Mr. Oliver; James; Dixie [Pons]; received bid to Washington and Lee Easter dances from Roger White; Worline; Coumerilk; Romeo and Juliet at the movies; Betty Sommerville; took pictures]
